article.kicker: We are speeding on a highway to hell...
article.head: ...and we need to slow down .

text.p: A project by Núria Altimir, Victor Garcia, Rebecca Pazos & Oriol Vidal

steps.p: We are speeding on a highway to hell ...and we need to <b slow down /b>. And, yep, that red smokes is what CO<sub>2 would look like if you could see it - scroll on to see how it's grown.
Human activity is increasing the amount of CO<sub>2 in the atmosphere.
The more CO<sub>2, the more global warming.
By current estimates, we people have emitted about 2200 Gt of CO<sub>2 in the atmosphere. This amounts to almost 1 ºC of global warming already.
Where has all that CO<sub>2 come from? Most of it have been direct emissions from fossil fuel combustion, all type or energy production, and industrial processes.
Those were just the direct emissions. There is also CO<sub>2 accumulating resulting from deliberate human activities on land, including those leading to land-use change.
At the current speed of increase, global warming will reach 1.5 ºC by 2040
